item.title: Node.js with TypeScript
item.description: The idea with this article is to simply provide a quick tutorial on how to set up a simple Node.js project with nodemon for development reloading and of course unit tests. This means I have gone for a minimalist approach and tried to keep everything as generic as possible by not doing things like sticking to my preference of Yarn or adding unnecessary dependencies. Let’s start off the same way we start any node project, running npm init in our project’s folder.
